nars.truth

Interface Truth

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, MetaTruth<java.lang.Float>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractScalarTruth, DefaultTruth, ProjectedTruth

    public interface Truth
extends MetaTruth<java.lang.Float>
    scalar (1D) truth value "frequency", stored as a floating point value

      • isNegative

        default boolean isNegative()
        Check if the truth value is negative
        Returns:
        True if the frequence is less than 1/2

      • hash

        static int hash(@NotNull
                Truth t)
        The hash code of a TruthValue, perfectly condensed, into the two 16-bit words of a 32-bit integer. Since the same epsilon used in other truth resolution here (Truth components do not need the full resolution of a floating point value, and also do not need the full resolution of a 16bit number when discretized) the hash value can be used for equality comparisons as well as non-naturally ordered / non-lexicographic but deterministic compareTo() ordering.

        provides a statistics summary (mean, min, max, variance, etc..) of a particular TruthValue component across a given list of Truthables (sentences, TruthValue's, etc..). null values in the iteration are ignored
